My most played game, with almost 1700 hours at the time of this review. A very fun, time consuming game that is not pay 2 win. Although there is a skin system, they do not effect your playing, just for customization. It consists of 3 main gamemodes (w/ 2 other gamemodes that nobody plays) Competitive, which you will be playing a lot of, a 5v5 first to 16 rounds. This game is based off an ingame economy, where you must manage your money during each round and decide what weapon you can afford, or if you're willing to glass cannon an awp. The next gamemode is Deathmatch. Deathmatch is up to a 10v10 literal deathmatch where players spawn randomly around the map. Different weapons give different amounts of points, and the player with the most points by the end of the 10 minute round wins. This gamemode is very good for warming up or practicing. The last gamemode is Casual, up to a 10v10 game where it's first to 7 rounds. It is very similar to competitive except for the fact that it's 10v10, and also you automatically start with armor, meaning you don't have to buy it like you do in competitive. The other 2 gamemodes are demolition and arms race, arms race in which you cycle through all the weapons by getting 2 kills, and demolition is basically competitive, but for all the kills you get each round you upgrade your weapon and also potentially gets you grenades to use for the next round. Demolition and Arms Race are very unpopular, and I would recommend Casual and Deathmatch over them. 

Rounds:

Each round consists of the Terrorists (T's) and Counter-terrorists (CT's). The CT's job is to defend a bombsite in gamemodes Casual, Competitive, and Demoliton, and fend off the attacking T's, who must plant the bomb in the designated area, eliminate all the CT's, or have the bomb explode. If the bomb is planted, CT's must defuse it to win the round. There is a very rare gamemode that you'll almost never play in low ranks, which is Hostage. In Hostage, T's must defend hostages and prevent the CT's from extracting them to a location.

Weapons:

Counter-Strike:Global Offensive consists of 2 main rifles, the M4A1-S/M4A4 (You can choose between either) and the AK-47. The M4's are for the CT's, and the AK for the T's. The AK-47 is a very powerful rifle, and I would recommend tap firing at long range in the head, because the AK is an automatic 1-shot in the head, no matter what range. All weapons have recoil, and to get better, you must master these, and be able to spray accurately. Every automatic weapon has a unique spray pattern and you'll need to compensate for recoil when spraying by pulling down. The AK-47 is $2700, while the M4's are both $3100. There is also 1 main sniper rifle, the AWP, a powerful 1-shot anywhere from the waist up. The AWP can penetrate the thick walls giving you an advantage. The AWP is $4750, making it the most expensive weapon in the game at it's current state. If you can use it right, you can make it worth it's hefty price. Keep in mind, moving while shooting is not viable with rifles or snipers, and your accuracy will pay the price for running while moving. However, there are other weapons, such as the SMGs, the MP9(CT), MAC-10(T), MP7, UMP-45, P90, and PP-Bizon. The PP-Bizon is complete shit, unless you can hit the headshots, which can barely 2 shot a player in the head at close range with armor. The MP9 and MAC-10 are counterparts, and are both viable while running and gunning. Then there's the shotguns, with the MAG-7(CT), Sawed-Off(T), Nova, and XM1014. The MAG-7 is a CQ shotguns to hold corners. Awards you with a good amount of money per kill. The XM1014 is a scumbag weapon, an automatic close-medium range shotgun. The MAG-7's T counterpart the Sawed-Off is complete shit, that nobody should use except for JW. Then there's the meme weapons, the Machine Guns. The M249 and Negev are shit and don't ever use them. There are also pistols, which you automatically spawn with at the start of each round, the USP-S/P20000(CT) and the GLOCK-18(T) The GLOCK excels at close to medium range, with a secondary burst fire mode, where you fire 3 bullets almost simultaneously. This is only viable in very tight spaces and while holding a corner. The USP-S and P20000(P2K) are basically the same, but the P2K has 13 shots in a clip, while the USP has 12. The USP is slightly more accurate, while the P2K is practically the same, but more ammo. The P250 is a great eco gun, that can close range 1-shot headshot armored opponents, with 13 shots in a clip. If you can aim, this gun is for you. If you can't aim, I would recommend the TEC-9 (T aka Rek-9) and Five-Seven(CT) They're both high ammo guns that you can fire as fast as you can click, with a 1-shot headshot on armored opponents, at close to medium range. The CZ-75 is the Five-Seven's counterpart, which has 2 clips of 12 bullets, but is automatic, good for close range, as it can spray down enemies. I would recommend the Five-Seven, as it is easy to use, while the CZ you must manage you're ammunition and hit your shots more often. There are also the dualies, which are pretty shit unless you can aim for the head at CQ, but are usually just for meme strats, like the NiP crabwalk. I wouldn't really use them, as they are like the Rek-9 and Five-Seven except do much less damage and armor penetration. Then, there's the Juan Deag. This skillful weapon can only be viable if you can aim very well. The Desert Eagle is known for it's crisp Juan Deags that can take out almost any oppenent with 1 shot to the head. If you can use it right, you can kill everyone while also looking like a complete badass. - Señor Juan Deag 
Last but not least, the Famas(CT) and Galil(T). The Famas and Galil are almost neck and neck, as they are counterparts and are only a $200 difference. Both are viable, not as an M4 or AK, with 2 shots to the head against armor, but pretty good. If you can't afford an M4 or AK with armor, the Famas/Galil is for you.

Maps:

CS:GO consists of a shitload of maps, but the only map you'll be playing if you're in silver is Dust II, which is a very iconic map that goes back to CS 1.1, as it takes place in a Middle-Eastern area. The other somewhat played maps are (in no particular order) Mirage, Overpass, Cobblestone, Inferno, Train, Cache, and Nuke. Recently, Nuke and Inferno got a reskin, and look fresh, but Nuke is very dead map and most feel like it was changed too much.

CS:GO is a fun game, with 18 different ranks that you can rise up to, and challenge the best. I will say, it is very hard to get out of silver, unless you're doing very good in your placement matches. Make sure you're ready for competitive, as if you quit in the middle of a match, timeout, lagout, or disconnect that you're willing to take at the least a 30 minute competitive match ban or up to a 7 day ban. *There is team damage in competitive, and you can get banned for killing or doing too much damage to teammates*. Try your hardest and make sure you know the game before doing your placement matches, as once you achieve a rank, you may become stuck at the rank for quite a while. To rankup, you need to focus on MVP's. Kills, Deaths, Assists, and time played does not effect you're possibility to rankup.
